objectives: Coordinate timing with clear hand signals and concise ASL lines
Use visual cue vocabulary for start/stop, ready, and transitions
Handle simple contingencies (late performer, tech issue) with calm, short updates

vocab.def: Palm up small nod; confirm position.
Index move to next anchor; transition.
Tech terms; point to device anchor.
Quick repair or alternate; concise line.

sections.heading: 1) Visual Cues & Hand Signals
sections.body: Core set: **READY**, **GO**, **STOP**, **NEXT**. Agree backstage anchors and repeat the same signals every time.

sections.heading: 2) Timing Updates (‚â§ 6 signs)
sections.body: Use Time ‚Üí Topic ‚Üí Comment: **NOW ‚Üí BAND ‚Üí READY?** / **2-MIN ‚Üí NEXT ‚Üí DANCE.** Keep updates short so hands are free for pointing.

sections.heading: 3) Tech Fix Lines
sections.body: Fix fast, then confirm: **MIC PROBLEM. HOLD. FIX-SHORT. READY? GO.** Point to device and performer anchors while updating.

sections.heading: 4) Contingency: Late Performer
sections.body: Plan B template: **PERFORMER LATE / NOT-YET. SWITCH ‚Üí NEXT ACT. AFTER ARRIVE ‚Üí INSERT.** Keep audience calm with emcee line later.

sections.heading: 5) Partner Drill: Cue Chain

media.caption: Pass READY ‚Üí GO ‚Üí STOP ‚Üí NEXT cleanly

sections.body: A (stage manager) cues B (performer) through **READY ‚Üí GO**; inject a **STOP** and a **NEXT** switch. Swap roles.

sections.heading: 6) Mini-Scenario
sections.body: Choose one: **mic fails**, **lights too bright**, **video not playing**. Give two short updates and one confirmation before GO.

summary: You coordinated backstage flow using a stable cue set, concise timing lines, and calm contingency updates with confirmations.
